main_definition: Efficiency is the ability to accomplish a task with minimal waste of time, effort, or resources.

meanings_and_examples.example: In manufacturing, efficiency can be measured by how many products are produced using the least amount of raw materials and energy.
An efficient computer system uses its processing power effectively to run multiple programs without slowdowns or crashes.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Streamlined processes that reduce unnecessary steps
meanings_and_examples.example: A company improves efficiency by automating repetitive tasks, such as data entry, allowing employees to focus on more complex work.
An efficient worker learns new techniques and methods that allow them to complete tasks faster without compromising quality.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Economical use of energy or effort in achieving a goal
meanings_and_examples.example: Using LED bulbs instead of incandescent ones is more efficient as they provide the same amount of light while using less electricity.
